meanings.definition: A style of South African music characterized by a fast tempo and jazzy beat.
meanings.sent1: The band played a lively kwela tune that got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent2: The kwela music filled the air with its energetic rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to mimic the kwela music with their makeshift instruments.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a kwela melody, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The kwela beat was so catchy, it stayed in my head all day.

meanings.definition: To play or perform in the style of kwela music.
meanings.sent1: She loves to kwela on her flute during family gatherings.
meanings.sent2: They decided to kwela together at the upcoming talent show.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to kwela along with the music, pawing at the strings of the guitar.
meanings.sent4: His fingers danced on the piano keys, kwelaing out a cheerful melody.
meanings.sent5: The street performer began to kwela, drawing a crowd with his lively tunes.

meanings.definition: A type of dance associated with kwela music.
meanings.sent1: The dancers moved gracefully to the kwela beat, their feet tapping in sync.
meanings.sent2: At the festival, everyone joined in the kwela dance, swaying to the music.
meanings.sent3: The kwela dance competition brought out the best moves from all participants.
meanings.sent4: Her performance on stage was like a kwela dance, full of energy and rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The kwela dance troupe amazed the audience with their synchronized steps.
